description.method_description: Reject option classification is a postprocessing technique that gives favorable outcomes to unpriviliged groups and unfavorable outcomes to priviliged groups in a confidence band around the decision boundary with the highest uncertainty. This is done by flipping the labels for the samples of these groups close to the decision boundary.

pipeline.model_description: Reject Option Classification is compatible with any underlying learner that can produce scores of predicted probabilities.

fairness.fairness_description: The critical region size is determined based on optimizing the chosen fairness guarantee.

implementation.description: Input data has to be formatted as an AIF360 dataset.
